channel.title: Ramah: Good News Feed

item.title: Is China quietly winning the AI race?

item.title: Queensland researchers are using a popular pet fish to test rare genetic variants

item.title: Five Great Reads: a week without ultra-processed foods, props for the prop masters, and the Old Believers who time forgot
item.description: Dear readers, at the end of another hectic news week I am grateful to Dave Mustaine’s “let there be shred!” declaration for helping take the edge off.

item.title: Telly’s "free" ad-based TVs make notable revenue—when they’re actually delivered
item.description: Telly, a company that accepts advertising data instead of cash for its TVs, has reportedly had a hard time getting its “free” TVs into people’s homes.

item.description: When Christian Bryson needs quick weather information, like for this weekend's massive snowstorm, he doesn't wait for the 5 p.m.

item.title: UK ministers urged to release ‘withheld’ safety reports on smart motorways
item.description: Road campaigners and motoring organisations have urged UK government ministers to immediately release a series of “withheld” safety assessments of smart motorways – some dating back to 2022.

item.description: The Guardian’s journalism is independent.

item.title: Tiny falcons are helping keep the food supply safe on cherry farms
item.description: Their presence appears to lower the risk of food-borne illnesses from pathogens.

item.description: The Guardian’s picture editors select some of the most powerful photos from around the world Continue reading.

item.title: Cocktail of the week: The Palomar’s bumblebee – recipe | The good mixer
item.description: This drink is full of ginger spice and aromatics from both the honey and the London dry gin.

item.title: From Attenborough’s gorilla mayhem to TV’s first gay kiss: the 100 biggest moments from a century of television
item.description: 1: 1926 On 26 January John Logie Baird gives the first public demonstration of television to members of the Royal Institution, from his lab in Soho.

item.title: Children and teens roundup – the best new picture books and novels
item.description: The Good Deed Dogs by Emma Chichester Clark, Walker, £12.99Three very good dogs’ attempts to help others keep backfiring with chaotic consequences – until they pull off a successful kitten rescue in this exuberantly charming picture book.

item.title: Add to playlist: the Regency-styled 80s synth-pop revivalism of Haute & Freddy and the week’s best new tracks
item.description: Just when you think pop is finally moving away from the synth-heavy 80s sound, another thrilling new act comes along to say: “Nope!” With shades of Erasure and a good dollop of theatre kid energy, Haute & Freddy are the Regency-styled freaks sending a jolt through TikTok.

item.title: Digested week: Let us focus on the few, brief bright spots we can
item.description: Ah, Blue Monday – it seems to come round quicker every year, no? For those of you not familiar with the term, it denotes the third Monday of January, which is alleged to be the most depressing day of the year.

item.title: US futures slip and world shares are mixed as Japan keeps its key interest rate unchanged
item.description: European shares were mixed after Asian markets advanced Friday as calm was restored after a tumultuous week.

item.title: Free air fryers to help people cook more healthily
item.description: Air fryers are to be given out free by a community group that has been teaching people how to cook as part of a scheme to help them eat more healthily.

item.title: Harry Styles: Aperture review – a joyous, quietly radical track made for hugging strangers on a dancefloor
item.description: Now the proud owner of six Brits, three Grammys and seven UK Top 10 singles, it’s fair to say Harry Styles has elegantly sidestepped the potholes that pepper the route from ex-boyband member to solo superstar.

item.title: Ukraine, Russia and US set for rare trilateral talks amid hopes for a breakthrough – Europe live
item.description: French foreign minister Jean-Noël Barrot will travel to Greenland in the coming weeks to show France’s support for the territory amid interest from Donald Trump.

item.title: Ari Lennox: Vacancy review – the R&B sophisticate’s loosest and most fun outing yet
item.description: Ari Lennox is one of contemporary R&B’s premier sophisticates, preferring a palette of lush jazz, soul and 90s hip-hop over the more genre-fluid sound pushed by contemporaries SZA and Kehlani.

item.title: To Lam wins second term to rule Vietnam through 2030
item.description: To Lam has been unanimously re-elected to continue leading Vietnam's ruling party until 2030.

item.title: Harry Styles says new single Aperture is comeback's 'perfect little bow'
item.description: An almost four-year wait for Harry Styles' new music is over, but he's been far from elusive in that time.

item.title: US-TikTok deal: A new reality for China's tech champions?
item.description: One in seven people in the world use TikTok.

item.description: This week’s best wildlife photographs from around the world Continue reading.

item.title: New UK passport rules designed to improve national security, government says
item.description: The British High Commission in Australia says it has received a large of volume of enquiries from British Australian dual citizens seeking clarity on the UK's new passport rules.

item.title: Consider the optics: why men have fallen back in love with spectacles
item.description: Last spring, Tom Broughton, founder of eyewear brand Cubitts, was asked to comment on a meme that was going viral, that featured a pair of his company’s ‘Plimsoll’ frames.

item.title: Vietnam's leader returns to power with bold promises. Can he deliver?
item.description: That was the pitch made by Vietnam's most powerful figure, Communist Party General Secretary To Lam, as he faced the nearly 1,600 delegates at the party congress, which gathered this week to determine the country's path for the next five years, and who leads it.

item.title: Producer's pride at legendary debut 20 years on

item.description: A Breton butter cake is a proud product of Brittany’s butter-rich baking tradition: dense, golden and unapologetically indulgent.

item.title: UK savers urged to move fast for the best deals paying up to 4.5%
item.description: Savers are being urged to shop around and move fast if they want to get hold of one of the competitive deals still available.

item.title: Victoria Mboko wins third-round tussle to set up Sabalenka showdown
item.description: Victoria Mboko has given herself a shot at Aryna Sabalenka, the world No 1, in the fourth round of the Australian Open, after the 19-year-old prodigy held her nerve at the end of an incredibly tense tussle to close out a 7-6 (5), 5-7, 6-3 win over the 14th seed Clara Tauson.

item.title: Sussan Ley confident she will survive as opposition leader and says door is open to Nationals rejoining Coalition
item.description: Sussan Ley says her likely leadership rivals Angus Taylor and Andrew Hastie remain committed to her position, as speculation grows about an imminent challenge to the embattled Liberal leader.

item.description: A marble sits at the top of a very long, elaborate and twisting run right now.

item.title: Minister told armoured vehicle which left soldiers vomiting was 'safe'

item.title: AI cameras helping to save rock fisherman 'shows technology works'
item.description: Surf Life Saving NSW says the successful rescue of a rock fisher at Kiama Blowhole earlier this month using two AI-enabled surveillance cameras proves the technology works.

item.title: ‘It has been overwhelming’: Sudanese friends complete 900-mile UK walk
item.description: When Giel Malual set out to walk the length of the UK to raise money to open a school for displaced children from his home country of Sudan, he did not expect the welcome he would receive from the British public.

item.title: Government admits its approval for Buckinghamshire AI datacentre should be quashed
item.description: The government has been forced to admit its own planning approval for a major AI datacentre should be quashed after it failed to fully consider the climate impact, in what campaigners described as “an embarrassing climbdown”.

item.description: Australia has named 53 athletes to compete at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milan-Cortina.

item.title: Toronto man posed as pilot to rack up hundreds of free flights, prosecutors say

item.title: Second season of With Love, Meghan fails to reach Netflix’s top 1,000
